ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Haste tests... Swirlspine Belt?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Swirlspine is supposed to be the same as the Belt of Concordance - 16% haste (or 13% delay reduction - you ll see both figures tossed around as speedup ).
ygData.messageBody:
On Tue, 4 Apr 2000, Marc Allie wrote:

> I am curious as to how the Swirlspine Belt figures into all this.
> I have heard rumors that it is both faster than, the same, and slower
> than the FBSS. Anyone have one they could try out? If it is indeed
> the same haste %, then by far it is better than the FBSS.

Swirlspine is supposed to be the same as the Belt of
Concordance - 16% haste (or 13% delay reduction - you'll see
both figures tossed around as "speedup").

> This is interesting, I have a monk friend who has some Cape off of
> Innoruuk that gives what he says is 30% haste, he might be interested
> to know that my lil' old Verses of Celerity might indeed give him
> maximum haste.

Heh. My monk friend put on his FBSS and I dueled him
afterwards. I was still grouped with him and played Anthem.
His punches were coming at max haste - every 2.0 seconds.
Ouch!

> Wonder how monk attacks like Dragon Punch and Flying Kick, and also
> Backstab figure into the equation.

I'm pretty sure haste lowers the recycle time on these
appropriately. That's what all the monks and rogues I've
spoken to have said.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
